p.s: The quote from Ludwig Wittgenstein, a germanGerman linguist philosopher who lived from 1889 to 1951 is nowadays more true than ever.
Of course, the world doesn't break down as soon as you cross a language border, but your experience does.
How should one be able to make new experiences when he can't speak the language?
Maybe one time, just not being able to talk is a new experience.
A world without communication is boring, and it is the same everywhere, just you and yourself.
The world is full of people, sounds and colours, if you can speak with them.
If not, everywhere it is the same - you are outside your world.
